articles.title: Video: Listen to Secret Service radio traffic as rioters breached the Capitol - CNN Video
articles.description: The January 6 committee played video of the January 6 riot synced with radio traffic from then-Vice President Mike Pence's Secret Service detail as they were working to get Pence to safety as rioters breached the Capitol.

articles.author: Marshall Cohen, Jeremy Herb and Zachary Cohen, CNN
articles.title: Takeaways from the January 6 hearings day 8
articles.description: The January 6 committee, in its final public hearing until the fall, presented damning new evidence Thursday highlighting then-President Donald Trump's three-hour refusal to publicly condemn the unfolding insurrection at the US Capitol or to call off the viol…

articles.author: Manu Raju, CNN Chief Congressional Correspondent
articles.title: Tammy Baldwin, who is gay, confronted Marco Rubio about calling same-sex marriage vote a 'stupid waste of time'
articles.description: As he was walking on an elevator on Wednesday, GOP Sen. Marco Rubio of Florida told CNN that a vote on a bill to codify same-sex marriage was a "stupid waste of time."

articles.author: Kate Bennett, CNN
articles.title: Melania Trump says she was 'unaware' of the January 6 insurrection as it was happening
articles.description: Former first lady Melania Trump said in a new interview with Fox that she was "unaware" of the ongoing riot on January 6, 2021, because she was too busy photographing a rug in the White House.

articles.title: New York adult diagnosed with polio, first US case in nearly a decade
articles.description: A person from Rockland County, New York, has been diagnosed with polio, the first case identified in the United States in nearly a decade.
articles.content:

articles.author: Analysis by Nathan Hodge, CNN
articles.title: The CIA chief says Putin is 'entirely too healthy.' What do we really know about his condition?
articles.description: CIA Director Bill Burns gave an unusually candid assessment this week, when he told attendees at the Aspen Institute's annual security confab that Russian President Vladimir Putin is "entirely too healthy."
